titlepage.titleproper: Patrick County [Virginia] Oral History Project Records, 1980-1981
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections Ms1983-007

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Tech, Blacksburg, Va.
did.unittitle: Patrick County [Virginia] Oral History Project Records, 1980-1981

physdesc.label: Physical Characteristics
physdesc.extent: 30 boxes (Boxes 1-13, 17, 17a, 17b are in larger record Cartons 1 & 2), including 202 cassette tapes, 74 sound reel to reel tapes, 80 slides, and 1 16mm film reel.

did.physloc: Please note: This collection is in off-site storage and requires 2-3 days notice for retrieval. Please contact Special Collections for more information.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from Patrick County Oral History Project Records must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The Patrick County Oral History Project Records were donated to Special Collections in 1982.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Patrick County Oral History Project Records, Ms1983-007, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of taped interviews; transcripts; biographical information about the interviewees; a subject card index to the interviews; a film, "Up and Down These Roads: a Rural County in Transition"; slide/tape programs; and such project documents as the original proposal, the final report, photographs, publicity clippings, and program posters. For a published guide to the collection, available in Special Collections, see Addison catalog record.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Sponsored by the Blue Ridge Regional Library and Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University to explore the theme of "Continuity and Change in a Rural Community." It was conducted between September 1980 and August 1982. The project began by presenting a series of folklife programs on local traditions of music, dance, verbal art, history, and material culture; continued by collecting and transcribing taped oral histories of families and communities, building a collection of photographs of the county's past and present, and expanding the public branch library's and the University library's collections in regional literature, folk culture, and history; and then combining these activities as resources for producing a series of public programs which pursued the basic theme of "continuity and change" in this rural Southwest Virginia county.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is in its original order, although some boxes have been condensed. Audio boxesoxes 1-12, which contain cassette tapes, are now in Boxes 1 and 2. Please note: Because materials were consolidated, there are no boxes 16, 21, or 26.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: There is also a published history and guide to the collection: Perry, Thomas David. 2009. Patrick County Oral History Project: A Guide. Ararat, Va: Laurel Hill Publishing. Spec Large F232 .P3 P4745 2009.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Two copies of the film "Up and Down These Roads" were found in this collection were removed and cataloged for the Newman Library Film Collection.
